name: places/ChIJ6YwJBp5ZwokR-7K0N4ZrAZw
formattedAddress: 441 E 12th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 441 E 12th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text: I am honestly shocked and upset as a parent who has paid a lot of rent to this firm on time every month for a number of years for my NYU student in the east village. You firm has failed to return our security deposit in violation of New York City law and refuses to even engage in a discussion by email with my student. Please other NYU parents do not rent for your child with this company. They are happy to take our money on the front end for our kids at NYU  but then don't live up to their  contractual, legal or just overall "what is right and decent" obligations. @ NYU Class of 2023 - Parents @nyu

originalText.text: East Village Property Management has been a delight to work with. Howard was very helpful in getting us all the information and answering almost every question as soon as he could. They were quite flexible regarding payment options and finalizing details of the lease. We had a 3-month furnished sublease and our unit had almost no issues. They've been very quick is fixing any slight problems we encountered, and even helped install my AC unit.

text.text: East Village Property Management has been a delight to work with. Howard was very helpful in getting us all the information and answering almost every question as soon as he could. They were quite flexible regarding payment options and finalizing details of the lease. We had a 3-month furnished sublease and our unit had almost no issues. They've been very quick is fixing any slight problems we encountered, and even helped install my AC unit.

originalText.text: I understand how difficult it is to find an apartment in NYC, but please avoid renting from this management if possible. I lived in a 4br unit for just 5 months and every interaction I had with them was negative. We had hot exposed pipes in our rooms and asked them to insulate them, and they took a long time to send a random contractor who told us he had no idea what he was doing. They frequently entered our apartment using their own set of keys with no notice, either just to look around or to give a tour, and they entered our bedrooms without permission. We asked them to please let us know when they were scheduling tours, and they sent us an email literally 1 minute before entering or also continued to give no notice. We also never got our full security deposit back and have contacted them asking for at least a written explanation, which we never received. They raised our rent from 6000 to 7500 (for 4br) which is why we left.

originalText.text: East Village Property Management has been one of the most friendly, helpful and easy to work with property management companies I've ever worked with. Their office staff is always super responsive, quick to take action if something needs fixing with our home, and extremely caring/friendly when communicating with them whether in person, via email, or over the phone. I've felt extremely safe, secure, and supported living in an East Village Property Management run apartment and am SO glad I chose to live here! I would recommend any apartment buildings run by this management company. We also plan to renew our lease since it's been such a positive experience here!

text.text: East Village Property Management has been one of the most friendly, helpful and easy to work with property management companies I've ever worked with. I would recommend any apartment buildings run by this management company. We also plan to renew our lease since it's been such a positive experience here!

originalText.text: I lived here for a year with my roommate and over my 3 years of living in the city, this has got to be the worst management I've ever encountered. Concerns don't get met until weeks later. We had an issue with rats and roaches entering the apartment and instead of immediately checking on the apartment, they waited until the NYC department of Housing Preservation and Development conducted an inspection and issued multiple violations to the apartment because of it. As well as that it's been 3 weeks since we moved out and my roommate and I have yet to see our security deposit. When I contacted management about it they shipped the check without verifying the address with me first, so it was sent to a non existent apartment. Then, when I contacted and asked for an update, tracking number, the manager just told me to check back in Wednesday. Mind you, my new address is only a 15 minute subway ride away. This place isn't transparent, will keep your money from you, and let you live in filth until you have to contact the NYC HPD yourself. Save your money, go live with another company that actually values their tenants and won't withhold your money from you. If it hasn't been delivered by this week, I will be taking this to small claims court :) this isn't the first time this management has gotten in trouble for this.
